p: The algorithm begins with a data set of interest that consists of a point cloud X containing N points x ∈ M sampled from a space M whose topology we want to elucidate. We define a real valued function f: X → R ( f is referred in the literature as a lens or filter) whose value is known for the N data points. Next, we find the range I of the function f that is restricted to the points in X. We divide this range into a set S of smaller intervals of the same size, that overlap. This results in two parameters that can be used to control how detailed a representation of the data, i.e. the “resolution”, namely the number l of the smaller intervals and the percentage overlap q between successive intervals.
